body.p: Some support the principle of determining recoverable amount on an individual asset basis only. This view was expressed by a few commentators on E55. They argued that:

li.p: it would be difficult to identify cash‑generating units at a level other than the business as a whole and, therefore, impairment losses would never be recognised for individual assets; and

it should be possible to recognise an impairment loss, regardless of whether an asset generates cash inflows that are independent from those of other assets or groups of assets. Commentators quoted examples of assets that have become under‑utilised or obsolete but that are still in use.
